text:
0 Feb 28, 2017 10:09:58 EA have announced hundreds of players have had their ratings permanently altered - both up and down - in their latest ratings refresh 
EA Sports have announced their Winter Ratings Refresh for selected players from the rest of the world on FIFA 17. 
Hundreds of players will have their ratings permanently updated in FIFA's Ultimate Team as part of the Ratings Refresh campaign, with players from the top five European leagues already revealed. 
The last batch of updates sees players from other countries and leagues updated, including Porto midfielder Danilo Pereira and Sporting striker Bas Dost both getting upgrades in the Portuguese Primeira Liga. 
Dutch forward Dost is currently the league's top scorer with 18 goals. 
Serie A FUT upgrades 
As a result, his rating his risen from 78 to 80, while his Sporting team-mate Adrien Silva has risen from 82 to 83 overall. 
Elsewhere, Zenit St Petersburg midfielder Giuliano gets a boost from 80 to 82, and Shakhtar Donetsk's Marlos receives two additional rating points (80 to 82) as well as a position change to right midfield. 
Among those heading in the opposite direction are Aston Villa defender Micah Richards (77 to 74) and Rangers' Nico Kranjcar (75 to 70). 
"The updated ratings will apply to new base items which are found in packs, however some existing In-Form versions of select players will be automatically updated," a statement on EA's website reads. 
FULL LIST
